You all right?
I can't fucking breathe. I'm sorry.
Boyd, followed by Michael exits the restaurant.
(approaching) OK. Definitely not cool! Definitely  inappropriate behavior here.
Shut up Boyd.
Negative. This is not what we have  worked out in terms of presented  behavior.
He's having a problem here.
What's the problem Adam?
Moore joins the group.
What's the problem?
All eyes on Adam, who's eyes are starting to tear up.
What is your problem?
I can't do this.
Can't do what?
We're gonna get caught. I know we're  gonna get caught. They were eyeballing  my car.
What?
At the seven-eleven.
Who? What are you talking about?
They're on me. They're smoking me  out!
(shouts) Nobody's smoking anybody out.
Shut up.
Quiet.
Liz is at the door of the restaurant.
Keith? Is everything okay, honey?
Fisher bolts over to Liz.
Yeah baby. Everything's great.
Well, can you come back inside?
(not moving) Yeah. Sure.
Now?
Yeah. Look honey, I'll be right in.  I just... we're just taking care of  some Groomsmen last minute business.
Mr. Fisher approaches.
Everything okay?
Yeah, Dad. It's great.
Well, I'm in the middle of my goddamn  toast here.
OK, OK. You guys just go back in.  Dad, keep going with the toast, we'll  be right in. Go on.
Fisher ushers his father and Liz back inside, then turns, quickly head back to the parking lot where things are  escalating.
(on Adam) You got some mighty fucking fine bad  timing Adam. We got a rehearsal  situation here.
I don't give a damn.
About anybody but yourself. You never  have.
And you're a little fucking reject.
Eat my ass!
Hey!
Michael kicks it again, harder. Adam shoves him.
If you ever touch my minivan again,  I'll make you sorry. Real sorry.
You're a loser.
You're the loser! A big black hole  sucking up everything you touch! YOU  MURDERED THAT GIRL! MURDERER!  MURDERER!
You're the loser! You think your  shit's so fucking righteous! FUCK  YOU! You were there with us, boy!  Right there! SIDE BY FUCKING SIDE!!!
Shut up!
Shut your fucking mouths!!!
Boyd and Fisher separate the brothers.
(freaking) I didn't do anything! I'll turn your  pathetic ass in!
Adam! Calm down.
I won't calm down. I can't do this.  We can't do this. It won't work. It  will not work.
It has worked.
I'm talking about DNA samples, fiber  optics, search parties, they got  infrared scanners, FBI scientists.  They figure this shit out. They always  figure it out.
They won't figure it out.
I got children. I've got a life.
You got a retarded kid and a fat pig  wife.
You fucking bastard!
Adam attacks Michael, slashing, biting, mauling, the brot go down hard, slugging it out on the ground.
Liz is back at the restaurant door.
Keith?!
Fisher bolts over to Liz.
Everything's OK. Just some more  preparations.
Are they fighting?
No baby. We'll all be right in.
Fisher pushes her inside and charges back to the...
Fisher helps break the fight. Adam and Michael try to con their rage.
This is going to stop right now.  Right now!
(seething) You will not screw this up.
Don't you threaten me you little rat  fuck.
Don't you fucking threaten me --  I'll fucking kill you.
Go home!
You go home!
Boyd pulls Michael to his car.
Why don't you just cool out. Go home  and go to sleep.
Boyd opens Michael's car door, puts him in.
Just go home, chill the fuck out.  Okay?
Michael starts his car. Boyd shuts the car door.
Just go home.
MICHAEL, eyeballs Adam. Adam eyeballs him right back. Mic hits the gas and screeches away.
All right. Let's all go back in.  Adam? You're cool right?
No. I'm not Boyd. I am not cool at  all.
Reluctantly, they start back in. A hundred or so feet away, Michael's car comes to an abru stop. They all turn. Michael turns his car around, idles a moment.
Michael in a trance, staring at the guys watching him.
Mr. Fucking Minivan...
He hits the gas.
Wheels spin, rubber burns. The guys watch as Michael spee full throttle, like a battering ram, right at Adam's belo minivan.
NOOOO!!!!
Adam jumps between the minivan and Michael's car.
Michael's expression turns to horror. He slams on the bra but it's too late.
Michael's car crushes Adam like a sandwich meat between h car and the minivan. Metal, flesh, severed limbs, Adam  explodes like a gnat.

head_text.subj: THE HORRIFIED EXPRESSIONS OF BOYD, MOORE AND FISHER

text: Chaos. The room is filled with people from the Rehearsal  Dinner. Black-eyed, nose broken, LOIS sobs, surrounded by her kid and Liz. Boyd and Fisher talk to the POLICE.
It was just a crazy freak accident.  He thought the car was in reverse...  He didn't realize.
The COP takes notes. MICHAEL sits in a corner by himself. Ghost white. Trembli
Was there some sort of an argument?
No. Nothing like that.
We heard there was some arguing going  on. Some loud talk.
No. No. We were just all outside  just talking.
What were you talking about?
The wedding. We were talking bout  how it was going to be one of the  last times for us to all be together  with Fisher not being married...
A lot of people seem to think there  was some hostility out there.

(getting righteous) Well I can't really comment on what  "a lot of people" thought. I can  only tell you that we had a horrible  accident here and were all feeling  extremely traumatized and your  questions are a bit poorly timed.  We're in full on grieving mode right  now thank you very much Officer...  Randone.
Easy Boyd.
No easy Boyd! I got a best friend in  there in pieces. How about a little  sensitivity?
Boyd storms off, goes and sits with Michael. Fisher stays with the cop.
That's all I wanted to know.
A DOCTOR appears in the doorway.
His situation is critical. He's asking  to speak to his wife.

SHOTS of the guys eyeing each other nervously as Lois slo gets up and follows the Doctor into a treatment room. The guys move to the door, where they can see Lois, leani over the hospital bed, talking to Adam.
Adam hooked up to dozens of wires, etc... Lois leans over to kiss him. Adam appears to be whisperin something to her.
Watching Adam speak to Lois... Nervous.

Lois has her ear to Adam's mouth. He is clearly speaking her. Lois is sobbing when... ALARMS GO OFF IN ADAM'S ROOM A MEDICAL TEAM rushes into the room. Adam is a v-tach --  Heart's not beating. The team injects medicine, defribula Lois watches in horror as her husband dies in front of he Finally a DOCTOR calls time of death. Lois collapses on the floor.
The guys have witnessed Adam's death. Michael turns in ho Boyd, Fisher and Moore stare. Liz rushes to Fisher, throw her arms around him, overcome with grief.
Fisher, Boyd, Moore and Michael eat eggs.
The need to know is clear. What did  Adam tell Lois? That's the name of  the game. What did Adam tell Lois?  What does Lois know?
Ball park sausages.
You want some breakfast meat, Michael.  Is that what you want?

(clearly starting to  crack) Franco Harris has a flare for the  dramatic. The former Pittsburgh  Steeler running back, beat known for  "The Immaculate Reception," his  improbable sixty yard Ricochet  Reception. I say Ricochet Reception  has made a bold move on corporate  America. (inappropriately loud) Harris has lead a group of investors  in the purchase of the Park Sausage  Company. By taking on the challenge  of resurrecting Park's, Harris is  engaged in the equivalent of a sudden  death overtime.
Easy Michael.
(on a roll) He must take an open-field run to  profitability through excessive debt  large competitors and dwindling market  share. Before the clock runs out.
CUSTOMERS are starting to pay notice.
Shut up Michael.
(screams) I KILLED MY BROTHER!
All eyes on Michael. Boyd is immediately up trying to get Michael out of the booth. Casually, sweetly...
Okay. Time to fly.
Fisher helps Boyd lift Michael, who is becoming more and  more frenzied.
I ran down my brother in cold blood.  Shame on me! Shame! Shame! Shame!
WAITRESSES, COOKS and LATE NIGHT DINNERS stare, confused the HOWLING Michael is carried to the door.
(struggling) Time to pay the man. "For if we  confess our sins he is faithful and  just, to forgive us our sins, and to  cleanse us from all unrighteousness."
Fisher and Boyd struggle with Michael.
(tipping Waitress) Thank you.
She watches them haul Michael outside.
Michael thrashes wildly in the parking lot.
"Kill one man and you are a murderer!  Kill millions and you are a conqueror --  Kill all and you are a God!"
Michael breaks free, starts running away. Boyd, Moore and Fisher give chase. Moore dives on Michael's back. Fisher  helps Moore hold Michael down while Boyd gets the car.
(calming down) "The memory of the just is blessed  but the name of the wicked shall  rot."
Boyd is there with the car. They load Michael into the ba seat, climb in and disappear into the night.
Boyd drives, Fisher rides shotgun, Moore's in the back tr to contain Michael.
You will get yourself together here  mister. Are you hearing me?
Michael, now catatonic, stares out the window.
He's cracked up.
He is not cracking up.
Boyd... What have we done?
What did you ask me?
What?
What is the question you asked me?
I said, what have we done?
Yes, you did. Now that is the  question! That is exactly the question  we should be asking ourselves. You  tell me Fisher. What have we done?
I don't know! I just want to get  married.
Say it again.
What?
What you just said. Say it again.
I just want to get married.
Exactly! Exactly my point.
What's your fucking point?
I'm not talking to you?
What's your point?

You want to know what you are doing  here?! You are love pumping. You are  protecting all that is sacred and  beautiful and in sync with poetry  and sunsets and little newborn babies.  You are walking the walk. This is it  Fisher, the real stuff. You love  this woman. Love is second to nothing.  I love you. I love Moore. I love  Michael. This car is full of love,  and nothing -- absolutely nothing --  supersedes love, man. Nothing. We  will do what it takes. Whatever it  takes.
Boyd takes Fisher's head in his hands and kisses him deep on the mouth.
Love does not lose.
TIGHT ON Fisher, speechless.

A Jewish ceremony. A hundred or so guests. A RABBI conduc the service. Lois sits in shock flanked by her boys. Michael, Fisher, Boyd and Moore stand in positions of hon up front. They're all eyeing each other. Michael starts emitting deep, uncontrollable, highly  inappropriate MOANS.
Easy Michael.

Michael can't control himself as his body starts to seize and tremble. Moore and Boys attempt to stabilize Michael breaks away, charges over to Lois and buries his head in lap sobbing deeply. Everyone is stunned but the Rabbi  Continues.
Liz and Fisher.
(hysterical) Cancel?! Cancel?! Are you out of  your fucking mind?!
Nobody's saying cancel. I'm talking  about modifying.
No way.
Can we just talk this out?
Talk what out? We are locked and  loaded here. We are non-refundable.  I've got relatives on the airport  right now! I've got...
The phone RINGS. Fisher freezes.
Answer it!
Fisher picks up the phone.
Hello?
Lois on the phone, near hysteria.
Keith. It's Lois. I just found a  note up in Adam's study. It's some  kind of crazy confession about killing  a stripper and cutting up bodies  and...
(explaining) ...burying them outside of Vegas,  about Boyd being the ring leader...  She wants to know what the hell is  going on and I'm starting to freak  out here.
Boyd, Moore and Michael, looking particularly traumatized are seated at a booth with Fisher.
We're goosed.
We're not goosed.
What's goosed?
What is her disposition?
Regarding what?
Does she sound pissed, scared,  hostile? Did she mention the police?
No, but she's definitely pissed and  hostile. And she's clearly starting  to think that's something's not right.
Michael starts sobbing uncontrollably.
We're goosed! Goosed by God!
Michael get a grip. (to Fisher) What did you tell her?
I told her that I have no idea what  Adam was talking about in that letter.
Did she believe you?
I have no idea.
You can tell when people believe  you. It's obvious.
Well I don't have that skill and if  I had to guess I would say that in  no way did she believe me.
(screaming) Goosed!
Stop it!
Goosed!
People are staring.
Stop.
Goosed!
(to Moore) Give me the Valium.
He just had two.
Give me two more.
Moore counts out two Valium, hands them to Boyd as michae continues to freak.
(to Michael) Open sesame.
Michael complies like a puppy.
Jesus Boyd you're going to O.D. him.
Suck my ass.
TIGHT ON Lois, busted nose, eyes black.
I never liked you Boyd. You're a  snaky little fuck. Always have been.
WIDE ON the guys, seated around a little breakfast table. Michael's in a Valium stupor.
What are you talking about?
Don't sweet lip me.
I don't understand where this personal  attack is coming from...
You're a liar. I want to know what  happened in Vegas.
Nothing happened in Vegas.
I don't want to hear it from the  liar. Stick a plug in it Boyd. Fisher?  What happened in Vegas?
(beat) Nothing happened in Vegas.
(not buying it) Moore?
(sheepish) Nothing happened.
Michael starts back in with the power sobbing. All eyes a on him. Guilty, uncomfortable silence. Michael's coming  unglued.
Michael? Do you have something to  tell me?
Michael. Tell Lois that nothing...
Shut up Boyd! Michael?
All eyes on Michael.
(quiet) Goosed.
Fisher struggles to breathe. Boyd tenses up.
What?
Lois we were bad, we were very, very  bad.
He's upset about Adam. We're all  upset.
I will call the police right now if  I don't start getting some answers.
Lois please.
She heads for the phone.
Fuck you Boyd.
The guys are freaking as she picks up the phone. Boyd loo at the kitchen knives. Fisher sees him, intervenes quickl
Okay. Lois... here's the deal. (beat) Adam was with a prostitute in Las  Vegas.
Lois freezes, puts down the phone. Boyd and Moore look st at Fisher -- good lie.
What?
I'm sorry he was unfaithful to you.
And it wasn't the first time... He  had a thing about prostitutes.
Fisher gives Boyd a look. Lois starts to choke up.
(crushed) My Adam?
Lois crumbles before their eyes.
We're sorry.

Lois starts sobbing. Michael joins in. Adam Jr. and Timmy appear in the door, in their pajamas, awakened by the noi Seeing their mother in tears, they start to sob. The room filled with anguished tears. Boyd give Lois a glass of wa and a Valium.
Fisher and Moore load Michael into the car. Boyd leans in the back window. Adam Jr. and Timmy are in the backseat,  still in their P.J.'s.
Mommy just needs a little time out.  Everything's gonna be okay. Okay? (the boys don't answer) Okay.
Fisher starts to get in the car, Boyd pulls him aside, ve wound up.
After you drop the kids off, take  Michael home. Put a few drinks in  him so he'll sleep.
I don't think that's such a good  idea.
Just do it.
What are you going to do?
Take care of business.
(accusing) What does that mean?
And what does that mean? (off no response) Are you insane?! (whispers) You think I would hurt Lois?! She's  the mother of those kids! What is  wrong with you?
I don't know...
You got a nasty side to your thought  process.
TIGHT ON Fisher.
I'm sorry. Honey... it's just for  tonight.
Liz is in her robe, none too pleased. Adam Jr. and Timmy in the b.g. at the kitchen table eating cookies and milk.
Lois is a mess and Michael's really  upset. Everyone's upset.
We're not canceling.
I know.
I won't even discuss it.
No one's discussing it. I'm just  gonna run Michael home. I'll be right  back.
I need you to pick up the cake  tomorrow.
Don't we already have someone to do  that for us?
Yeah. You.
Okay. Okay.
Fisher kisses Liz and goes.
Dark, smoky, MUSIC. Michael, Fisher and Moore sit in a co booth.
(finger in his ear) Do you hear buzzing fish?
Buzzing?
Yeah. I got some kind of buzzing.  Like a zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz thing just  chipping away in the back of my skull.
I don't hear it.
Yeah, well, it's a nasty problem.
Have another drink.
TRACKING SHOT down hallway into bedroom where Lois sleeps peacefully.
Fisher and Michael. Moore, drinking, just listening.

Dad used to bring home these sparklers  to me and Adam. Out back we'd light  'em up. The three of us. We'd hold  'em up to the sky and watch the  explosions of light. Sparks. And dad  would be all... "Get ready"... "watch  for it"... "here it comes," here  comes the "wahoo"
The wahoo?

The sparkler would burn hot, then  hotter, then even hotter... and there  would be one moment of pure burn  when that little fucker would cook  just perfect. Perfect. It would only  last a second, but that second was  it. It was it. That's what dad had  us looking for... You get me?
The wahoo moment?
That's my point! You see Man...  burning at his absolute. To see all  the forces just come together, just  right, you know, just in perfect  harmony. That's what I'm driving at.  You get me?
I think so.

I've been looking for that flash and  I look and I look and I can't find  it. And what if I already had it?  You know. My moment? What if it's  gone? And I never saw it? (finishes drink) You're getting married, man. That's  a fucking beautiful thing. Just a  beautiful thing. I just can't stop  breaking beautiful things.

Lois' bedroom. As Lois sleeps, Boyd softly enters the roo Moving in on the sleeping Lois, another couple of steps, looms over her, reaches his hand to her throat when, sudd Lois' eyes snap open. Boyd is startled. Lois grabs mace f her night stand and sprays Boyd in the face. He MOANS,  stumbles back. Lois leaps on him like a shark slamming a  side of beef. They go down hard on the floor and start fighting like wi animals.
You picked the wrong woman mother- fucker!
As Lois sinks her teeth into Boyd's balls.
You see for me it's over. Over baby.  I'm gonna turn myself in. After the  wedding of course. After the wedding.  Out of respect.
I don't think that's a good idea.
I said out of respect. Respect for  you Fisher. For you and your wedding  and your beautiful bride. There will  be no more rain. You see where I am  here?
I appreciate it. I do, but... maybe  you ought to just ease up on yourself  a bit.

No. No. No. This is my doing. You  see I'm gonna have my wahoo spark  for my own. For Lois and the kids,  for my brother, for Franco. I'm gonna  turn myself in. I am all that. I'm  gonna do it for sweet Lois.

Boyd and Lois are choking the living shit out of each oth Boyd pulls back, swings with a left, Lois ducks, she swin a right cross to Boyds eye. He goes down. She jumps on hi Choking him like a mad dog. As Boyd struggles for air...
Fisher checks his watch as Michael fumbles with his eight shot of Yukon Jack.
If I was to think... If I were to  think... No I mean I have thinked it  over... I have. And without putting  a lot of pressure on you I just...  Well I just...
What is it?
(drunk-slow) Well if you do think about names...  Michael's a pretty good one... It's  done me all right.
Michael's eyes bore into Fisher, like he knows something  Fisher doesn't. Fisher's cell phone RINGS.
(answers) Yeah.
TIGHT ON Boyd, eye swelling, scratch marks, hair a crazy  mess.
(into the phone) Okay. Here's the deal and it's a  good one. Lois is cool. It's a  pacified situation.
What does that mean?
Michael stares at Fisher.
I'm talking about Lois having relaxed  her anxiety. Only deal is... you  still got Michael there?
Yeah.
Good deal. Lois just wants to hear  it from Michael.
Hear what?
That it was all an accident. She  wants to here it from Michael's mouth.
Now?
Michael drunkenly nods his head as if can hear the  conversation.
That's right.
Isn't it a little late?
Hold on a sec. (turns) Lois, you sure you wouldn't rather  do this in the morning?
PAN OVER to see Lois, half hanging off the bed, strangled death. Boyd won.
(back into phone) She says now's the time. (quietly) I got a peace treaty thing happening  over here... let's get this over  with.
Fisher's car pulls up. Boyd is waiting outside. He opens back door. Michael is drunk in the back. Fisher and Moore are up front.
Okay Michael, let's go. (helps him out) Upsy daisy big guy.
(hammered) How about my Fatburger?
Come on tough guy. Listen to me. (takes Michaels face  in his hands) You are going to tell Lois that it  was all an accident. Okay cowboy?  You got me?
I love you.
He's too drunk.
He's fine. Okay Mikey, let's go. (to Fisher and Moore) You guys stay here.
Boyd leads Michael into the house.
Fisher and Moore wait in silence...
(beat) I'm thinking about maybe making a  move.
A move?
Greenpeace.
Greenpeace?
Maybe go up to the North Pole, the  Arctic. Tag polar bears with dart  guns. I've always had a pretty good  aim...
A "POP" resounds from within the house. Moore and Fisher  lock eyes, frozen. Boyd comes jogging out the front door, hops in the back s Fisher and Moore turn, eyes wide.

Michael was having an affair with  Lois. That's what Michael and Adam  were arguing about in the parking  lot. Michael killed Adam in a jealous  rage. Lois broke it off with Michael,  he strangled her to death and then  shot himself in the head. (beat) Happens all the time.
Boyd touches the painful scratches on his face.
That Lois fought like a fucking  Comanche.
ON Fisher and Moore in stunned horror...
TIGHT ON BARRY MORRIS, mid-40's, attorney.

I don't see how this could have been  kept from you. The facts are quite  simple; last month Adam and Lois  changed their will. They requested  that you two, as a married couple,  be the Custodians of Record for their  estate including all properties,  cash holdings, security holdings  and... children. You are legal  custodians of the Brenn Trust.
Liz and Fisher, flanked by Adam Jr. and Timmy, eyes wide, they sit across from the attorney, totally bazooka'd. The stare in horror at Morris.
My god.
There's more.
More?
Adam and Lois were not terribly  prudent in terms of providing for  the possibility of the unforeseen.
What are you talking about?
I'm talking about Life insurance.  I'm talking about money.
Money?
Yes money. Adam had a five hundred  thousand dollar Term Life Insurance  Policy.
What does that mean?
That means we get five hundred  thousand to help raise the kids.
(amazed) No.
Yes.

Actually, no. Adam was switching to  a Whole Life Policy, but re-scheduled  his medical exam... and failed to  make his last payment... so his Term  Life lapsed. So it's value is null  and void. (off Liz's horror) Now he did have a pension account,  worth another 150 thousand.
(relieved) Well, oh...
And a house. Valued at 350 thousand.
So where's that leave us?
150 plus 350... we still get 500  thousand.

(beat) No. Not even close. With property  values down, the house is worth  100,000 less than 450 he paid for  it. With three credit cards, the  minivan payments, and other  outstanding debts... Plus the Income  and Estate Taxes assessed on his  IRA... (punches his calculator) You'll get, oh... in the neighborhood  of, ah... 14,223 dollars.
Adam Jr. suddenly slips off his chair, lands flat on his  back, starts struggling to get up. Fisher tries to help L Adam up.
Get away from me!
I'm just trying to help...
I don't want your help!
Stop kicking. Stop kicking!
Fisher manages to get Adam Jr. back up in his chair. Liz  looks rather horrified.
(breaking the tension) So. When is the wedding.
Tomorrow (at Fisher) We are getting married tomorrow.
Fisher drives, Liz up front, Adam jr. and Timmy in the ba Everyone is shocked in silence. Fisher looks deathly ill, like he's about to vomit. He pulls the car over and gets  out.
Fisher leans on the trunk, puking. Liz gets out to help h he starts crying. Liz is gentle and loving.
It's okay... It's okay baby. Cry for  Mama. Cry for Mama.
No it's not okay. It's not.
The kids watch from the rear view window but can't hear.
Cry for Boom Boom. It's okay.
(sobbing) Liz we've got to cancel, we have to  put it off.
(ice) Don't even.
Do you love me?
What?
Do you love me?
What kind of stupid question is that?
(breaking down) Oh God. We. Liz. We. We. Killed a  woman. We...
What are you talking about?
(completely hysterical) Oh Liz. We. God. We, in Vegas. Michael  crushed her skull. She was dead.  There was nothing else to do. It was  an accident.
Who's dead?
The prostitute.
You fucked a prostitute?
No Michael did. It was an accident.
You killed a prostitute.
Michael, by accident.
Call the police.
It's too late.
My God. You've got to call the police,  tell them it was an accident. Where  is she?
She's in the desert. She's out in  the desert.
You left a dead prostitute out in  the desert? Alone?
She's not alone... She's... Boyd...  Oh God... He's gone nuts... He killed  Lois and Michael... it's all...
Stop! You stop right here. I don't  want to know anymore. I told you not  to do this Bachelor Party thing. You  were warned.
But...
No buts. I told you your friends  were Jackasses.
But...

No buts. I've waited twenty-seven  years, twenty-seven years I have  focused and prepared to walk down  that aisle. I will not be derailed!  I will not be embarrassed! I will  not be denied! I am walking down  that aisle tomorrow come hell or  high fucking water!
Liz marches back to the car, gets in and slams the door.  Fisher just stares in shock.

It's pouring rain outside. Shots of guests dashing from their cars to the church. Fisher's parents with Adam Jr. and Timmy, looking overwhe Upstairs: Liz and her Bridesmaids help Liz get dressed.  Everyone looks depressed.
Fisher and Moore in tuxedos. Boyd enters, shuts the door. Fisher looks ill.
Okay, we're about two minutes out.  Moore, better take your position.
Moore looks at Fisher.
Chop chop.
Moore goes. A long tense BEAT between Fisher and Boyd.
This is a situation that defies  judgement. We have acted and showed  courage that is not of a kind known  by most.
I'm getting really tired of your  bullshit.
My what?
You've got a warped thought process.  Your brain doesn't function properly.
You care to add a little specification  to that slanderous accusation?
(snaps) I'm talking about some bad, bad,  very bad things. Bad things! Those  are bad fucking things!
Okay fine.
Fine? Fine what?
Whatever you say Kojak.
I'm serious.
I'm serious. I'm the serious one  here. I'm the one making the play.  I'm the Indian Runner. And I want my  money.
The organ is playing. The guests are seated. Liz and her  father are waiting in the front hall.
I told Boyd two fucking minutes!
What money?
Blood money. Insurance dollars that  you have thus fucking far decided  not to tell me about at all. In no  way have you mentioned that money.  And I find that to be very very  offensive.
You're sick.
(veins pulsing) And if you think you can fuck me,  don't. Cause I'm fucking insulated  Fisher. Protected. Backed up on  floppy. Do you get me? I want my  fucking money!
Not a prayer.
I'm a lifesaver. A lighthouse. Up  all night in the rain, in stormy  gale force wind, tornado and fucking  earthquakes. I stay lit for you. I  stay lit. I don't go dark. I never  go dark!
You need help.
Fisher turns away. BOYD combusts. He leaps on Fisher with wild cry.
I want that money!

Boyd and fisher fight like animals; choking, pounding,  mauling, a fight to the death. Fisher is losing, Boyd is  choking the life out of him, killing him. Fisher is going down, eyes rolling back, he's dying, until... CRASH. Boyd's head is caved in from behind. REVEAL Liz  wielding a big, heavy crucifix. Boyd slumps to the ground Fisher gasps for air.
